clinical_study.brief_title: Use of Intraoperative Clonidine for Prevention of Postoperative Agitation in Pedriatic Anesthesia With Sevoflurane.
clinical_study.official_title: Use of Intraoperative Clonidine for Prevention of Postoperative Agitation in Pedriatic Anesthesia With Sevoflurane.

lead_sponsor.agency: Professor Fernando Figueira Integral Medicine Institute

clinical_study.source: Professor Fernando Figueira Integral Medicine Institute

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine efficacy of intraoperative clonidine to prevent postoperative agitation in pediatric anesthesia with sevoflurane.

primary_outcome.description: Postoperative agitation will be assessed by the Pediatric Anesthesia Emergence Delirium Scale (PAED).

secondary_outcome.measure: Need for post-anesthetic drugs for treatment of agitation
secondary_outcome.description: Use of any drugs, such as sedatives, opioids, anti-inflammatory or anti-emetic for improvement agitation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Any occurrence of post-anesthesia accidents: falls, bruises or disconnection of catheters
secondary_outcome.description: If any accident occurs in the recovery room, and postoperative (falls, bruises) disconnection of intravenous catheter or injuries.
Clinical evaluation: patient awake, awake, alert or patient under hypnosis.
As parents answer the question if you are satisfied with the procedure performed, excluding other problems occurred in the hospital.

arm_group.description: Clonidine 1μg/Kg, IV, single dose, anesthesia intraoperative.
Usual care of Instituto de Medicina Integral Prof. Fernando Figueira.

intervention.description: 1μg/Kg, IV (in the vein) intraoperative. Number of Cycles: single dose.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Aged 2 - 12 Years.
- Need for tonsillectomy / adenotonsillectomy.
- Physical status of the American Society of Anesthesiologists (ASA) 1, 2 or 3.
- Anestesia geral com sevoflurano.
- Use of Intraoperative dipyrone, 30-50mg/Kg, IV.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Changes in consciousness.
- Neurological Deficit.
- Use of another drug as medication before anesthesia.
